page.title: 02A TYPICAL DAY
page.content: {A Typical Day by Sarah Southworth aged {10. }I wake in a morning and take a shower and brush my teeth with fluoride paste. I get dressed and pack my school lunch. we leave for school, having locked the door and put the key under a bucket. At school my friend Emma rings the bell for the start of lessons. We usually begin with mathematics. In assembly we sing songs and the girls play recorders to keep us in tune. At playtime we play games like tig, football, netball and hopscotch. We have more lessons like language work, science, topic, art and craft and music. We watch television programmes on the video and work with computer programs using the disk drive. I usually go home on the bus at 3 o'clock. I take my puppy out for a walk before tea, which might be sausages, chips and peas.
